title: Senate Passes Defense Policy Bill, Clearing It for Trump
summary: The legislation authorizes $900 billion for the Pentagon, provides a pay raise for troops, and has some measures to reassert congressional oversight.

title: Appeals Court Allows National Guard to Remain in D.C., for Now
summary: A three-judge panel voted unanimously to allow troops to stay in the capital for the duration of the appeal, citing the city’s unique legal status.

title: National Center for Atmospheric Research to Be Dismantled, Trump Administration Says
summary: Russell Vought, the White House budget director, called the laboratory a source of “climate alarmism.”

title: Trump Dangles Cash Payments to Assuage Affordability Concerns
summary: With tariffs unpopular and prices still high, the White House has teased the promise of tariff rebates and large tax refunds next year.

title: What Trump’s Embrace of Crypto Has Unleashed
summary: A boundary-pushing array of new crypto ventures have reached the stock market, enticing investors and leading to more risk taking.

title: Heating Costs Expected to Rise 9.2% This Winter
summary: Colder weather and rising electricity and fuel costs will lead to a big jump in costs for individuals, according to estimates from a group representing state energy officials.

title: New Details Emerge About How Rob and Michele Reiner Were Found
summary: A person close to the family provided a detailed account of what occurred in the Reiner house after a massage therapist received no response at the gate.

title: Warner Bros. Urges Shareholders to Reject Paramount Takeover Bid, Saying Ellisons ‘Misled’ Them
summary: The claim was made as part of Warner Bros. Discovery’s dismissal of Paramount’s hostile takeover offer.

title: The 25 Most Notable Movies of 2025: ‘KPop Demon Hunters,’ ‘Roofman’ and More
summary: We polled film experts in the newsroom. These are the titles that stuck with us this year.

title: Tankers Under Sanction Are Only a Subset of Fleet Moving Venezuelan Oil
summary: The scope of President Trump’s blockade against ships carrying oil from Venezuela was not clear on Wednesday.

title: Trump Revised Chevron’s Venezuela Deal. Maduro’s Oil Trader Profited.
summary: A firm controlled by a businessman tied to a seized tanker carrying Venezuelan oil has sold millions of barrels from a Chevron-operated oil field.

title: How the Rhinelander Trial Scandalized the Jazz Age
summary: Rhinelander v. Rhinelander was one of the most scandalous trials of the Jazz Age. 100 years later, it reads as a tragedy about the country’s original sin.

title: Suspect in Bondi Beach Killings Is Charged With Murder and Terrorism
summary: The Australian authorities said the 24-year-old man, who had been shot by the police, woke from a coma on Tuesday afternoon.

title: Bondi Beach Shooting Is a Reminder of ISIS’s Power to Inspire Attacks
summary: ISIS is too weakened to seize territory, experts said, but its ability to churn out propaganda aimed at provoking violence against the West persists.

title: Brown University Students Were Prepping for an Exam. Then, a Gunman at the Classroom Door.
summary: For the students in the Brown University review session, concerns about grades and questions about economic concepts would be forgotten in an instant.

title: One Way the Brown University Shooting Was Unusual: The Gunman Escaped
summary: It is rare for a gunman in a high-profile shooting to get away, and many are apprehended within days. The authorities shared grainy video and begged for tips as the search stretched into its fourth day.

title: Harvard Secretly Investigates Students Over Larry Summers Video on Epstein
summary: The students face discipline for recording Mr. Summers, the former Harvard president, discussing his ties to Jeffrey Epstein in a Harvard class.

title: With Rights and Resources Uncertain, They’re Seeking Sterilization
summary: More young, child-free women are pursuing the permanent form of contraception.

title: The Secret Trial of the General Who Refused to Attack Tiananmen Square
summary: In 1989, Gen. Xu Qinxian defied orders to crush the pro-democracy protests in Beijing. Now, leaked video from his court-martial is on YouTube.

title: Beloved Objects Cherished By Those We Lost in 2025
summary: Metal crosses, a recliner, a blue wedding suit: the most cherished belongings of Ozzy Osbourne, Brian Wilson, Kitty Dukakis and others.

title: What Is an American?
summary: If the post-Trump G.O.P. makes the same mistake the Democrats did with their identitarian fringe, Republicans will meet a similar fate.

title: Anti-Vaccine Influencers Are Only Getting Stronger
summary: I was wrong about how to push back.

title: Mr. Robot Will See You Now
summary: We look at the promise and peril of robots that look like humans.

title: Oscars Reach Deal With YouTube
summary: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences said that it had reached a deal with YouTube for exclusive rights to the show starting in 2029.

title: Greenpeace’s Fight With Pipeline Giant Exposes a Legal Loophole
summary: A court filing by a group with deep ties to the pipeline company Energy Transfer raises questions about the growing use of amicus briefs in litigation.

title: Gil Gerard, Star of ‘Buck Rogers,’ Dies at 82
summary: He was best known for playing the title character in “Buck Rogers in the 25th Century,” which ran on NBC from 1979 to 1981.

title: On British Roads, Chinese Cars Are Racing Ahead
summary: BYD, Chery and other Chinese automakers are winning over drivers in Britain, where tariffs are low and buyers are open to new brands.
